abstract: It has been a brutal time for companies hoping to go public, with a record number of initial public offerings being withdrawn in the first quarter of 2008. This makes the proposed stock sale of DigitalGlobe, a provider of satellite earth images whose customers include the United States government and Google, all the more interesting. Late Monday, the Longmont, Colo.-based company filed to sell as much as $250 million in stock on the New York Stock Exchange.
lead_paragraph: It has been a brutal time for companies hoping to go public, with a record number of initial public offerings being withdrawn in the first quarter of 2008. This makes the proposed stock sale of DigitalGlobe, a provider of satellite earth images whose customers include the United States government and Google, all the more interesting. Late Monday, the Longmont, Colo.-based company filed to sell as much as $250 million in stock on the New York Stock Exchange.
